content.question: Consider the functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> given by <math alttext="g open parentheses theta close parentheses equals sec theta"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sec</mi><mi>θ</mi></math> and <math alttext="h open parentheses theta close parentheses equals csc theta"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>csc</mi><mi>θ</mi></math>. Which of the following statements is true for both <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> ?

choices.label: The domain is all real numbers.

The range is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 1 close square brackets union open square brackets 1 comma infinity close parentheses"><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></math>.
The graphs of the functions have vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="theta equals pi n"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>n</mi></math>, where <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> is an integer.

The graphs of the functions have vertical asymptotes at <math alttext="theta equals pi over 2 plus pi n"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>n</mi></math>, where <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> is an integer.

content.answer: The range is <math alttext="open parentheses negative infinity comma negative 1 close square brackets union open square brackets 1 comma infinity close parentheses"><mfenced close="]"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>∪</mo><mfenced open="["><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></mfenced></math>.
